subject: Productivity
title: The Ivy Lee Method
description: Learn The Ivy Lee Method in one minute.

hook.text: In 1918, Charles Schwab paid consultant Ivy Lee $25,000 for a productivity tip. It took five minutes.

buildup.text: The method: write six tasks tonight. Rank them. Tomorrow, work on number one until it's done. Then number two.

discovery.text: No multitasking. No reprioritizing mid-day. The constraint forces focus and eliminates decision fatigue.

twist.text: In today's dollars, Schwab paid about $500,000 for that advice. He said it was the most profitable he ever received.

climax.text: The method works because it's brutally simple. Six items. One at a time. No negotiation.

punchline.text: Six tasks. In order. One at a time. Done.

quiz.question: What is the core rule of the Ivy Lee Method?
options: Work on tasks one at a time in ranked order
Only work on tasks that take under an hour
